results.title: Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy in normotensive people with type 1 diabetes. The EUCLID Study Group. EURODIAB Controlled Trial of Lisinopril in Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus.
results.text_hl: This 50% reduction was the same when adjusted for centre and glycaemic control (0.55 [0.30-1.03], p = 0.06). @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ also decreased progression by two or more grades (0.27 [0.07-1.00], p = 0.05), and progression to @<m>DISEASE_603933</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:603933 @@@proliferative retinopathy@@@ (0.18 [0.04-0.82], p = 0.03).

citations.NLM: Chaturvedi N, Sjolie AK, Stephenson JM, Abrahamian H, Keipes M, Castellarin A, Rogulja-Pepeonik Z, Fuller JH. Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy in normotensive people with type 1 diabetes. The EUCLID Study Group. EURODIAB Controlled Trial of Lisinopril in Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus. Lancet. 1998 Jan 3;351(9095):28-31. PMID: 9433426

EURODIAB Controlled Trial of Lisinopril in Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus.}, author={Chaturvedi N and Sjolie AK and Stephenson JM and Abrahamian H and Keipes M and Castellarin A and Rogulja-Pepeonik Z and Fuller JH}, journal={Lancet}, volume={351}, number={9095}, pages={28-31}}

results.title: [Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus].
results.text_hl: Progression by two levels or progression to @<m>DISEASE_603933</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:603933 @@@proliferative retinopathy@@@ were also significantly reduced in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group compared to the placebo group (odds ratio 0.27 and 0.18, respectively).

citations.NLM: Sjølie AK, Chaturvedi N, Fuller J. [Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus]. Ugeskr Laeger. 1999 Feb 15;161(7):949-52. PMID: 10051804
citations.BibTeX: @article{10051804, title={[Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus].}, author={Sjølie AK and Chaturvedi N and Fuller J}, journal={Ugeskr Laeger}, volume={161}, number={7}, pages={949-52}}

results.title: The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy.
results.text_hl: In the EUCLID Study, the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin converting enzyme@@@ (@GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@ACE@@@) inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ reduced the risk of progression of @DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ by approximately 50%, and also significantly reduced the risk of progression to @<m>DISEASE_603933</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:603933 @@@proliferative retinopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Sjølie AK, Chaturvedi N. The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy. J Hum Hypertens. 2002 Aug;16 Suppl 3():S42-6. PMID: 12140727
citations.BibTeX: @article{12140727, title={The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy.}, author={Sjølie AK and Chaturvedi N}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={16 Suppl 3}, pages={S42-6}}
